question_text: Fill in the blank to check if the number is greater than 3 in an if-else statement.

What will the following code output?
a = 33
b = 200
if b > a:
  print('b is greater than a')
wrong_answer1: b is not greater than a

question_text: What is the correct syntax for an 'if' statement?
Which of the following conditional statements checks if the first condition is false and tests a new condition?

What will the following code output?
a = 33
b = 33
if b > a:
  print('b is greater than a')
elif a == b:
  print('a and b are equal')
Which of the following is the correct syntax for an 'else' statement?

What will the following code output?
a = 330
b = 330
print('A') if a > b else print('=') if a == b else print('B')
What logical operator is used to test if two conditions are both true?
Which logical operator is used to test if at least one condition is true?
